item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Lucille Ball
item.description: "I'd rather regret the things I have done than the things that I haven't." -- Lucille Ball

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Max Beerbohm
item.description: "Nobody ever died of laughter." -- Max Beerbohm

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "The most wasted day of all is that during which we have not laughed." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life does not cease to be funny when people die any more than it ceases to be serious when people laugh." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Laughter and tears are both responses to frustration and exhaustion. I myself prefer to laugh, since there is less cleaning do to do afterward." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Pam Brown
item.description: "A friendship can weather most things and thrive in thin soil; but it needs a little mulch of letters and phone calls and small, silly presents every so often - just to save it from drying out completely." -- Pam Brown

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "There is one friend in the life of each of us who seems not a separate person, however dear and beloved, but an expansion, an interpretation, of one's self, the very meaning of one's soul." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Literature adds to reality, it does not simply describe it. It enriches the necessary competencies that daily life requires and provides; and in this respect, it irrigates the deserts that our lives have already become." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Carolyn Wells
Lindsay add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Read not to contradict and confute; nor to believe and take for granted; nor to find talk and discourse; but to weigh and consider. Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested: that is, some books are to be read only in parts, others to be read, but not curiously, and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Augustine Birrell
item.description: "An ordinary man can surround himself with two thousand books and thenceforward have at least one place in the world in which it is always possible to be happy." -- Augustine Birrell

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Oliver Goldsmith
item.description: "The first time I read an excellent book, it is to me just as if I had gained a new friend. When I read a book over I have perused before, it resembles the meeting with an old one." -- Oliver Goldsmith

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Readers are not sheep, and not every pen tempts them." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Austin Phelps
item.description: "Wear the old coat and buy the new book." -- Austin Phelps

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Logan Pearsall Smith
item.description: "People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Logan Pearsall Smith

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Too much of a good thing can be wonderful!" -- Mae West

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The trouble is not in dying for a friend, but in finding a friend worth dying for." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "When angry, count four. When very angry, swear." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "My books are water; those of the great geniuses is wine. Everybody drinks water." -- Mark Twain
